sentences.M1: A 20-year-old man wearing combat gear and armed with semiautomatic pistols and a semiautomatic rifle killed 26 people — 20 of them children — in an attack in an elementary school in central Connecticut on Friday.

sentences.M1: The principal had buzzed Mr. Lanza in because she recognized him as the son of a colleague.

assessment.overall importance of the change: Important - The change alters the understanding of how Mr. Lanza entered the school.
assessment.importance reason: The addition of details about the security system and the manner of entry significantly changes the narrative.
assessment.literature rationale: Changes in wording that clarify or alter the context of events can impact reader interpretation and understanding of the situation.
assessment.version diff summary: The sentence was rewritten to include details about the security system and the manner of entry.
assessment.overall assessment: The change in this sentence is significant as it alters the understanding of the circumstances surrounding Mr. Lanza's entry into the school.

sentences.M1: Moments later, she was shot dead when she went to investigate the sound of gunshots.
